definitions.definition: To show to be connected or involved in an unfavorable or criminal way.
examples: The evidence implicates involvement of top management in the scheme.

definitions.definition: To imply , to have as a necessary consequence or accompaniment .
examples: What did Nixon's visit to China implicate for Russia?

definitions.definition: To imply without entailing ; to have as an implicature .
To fold or twist together, intertwine , interlace , entangle , entwine .

main_definition: ( transitive , usually with in ) To show to be connected or involved in an unfavorable or criminal way.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , nonstandard ) To imply , to have as a necessary consequence or accompaniment .
( pragmatics ) To imply without entailing ; to have as an implicature .
( archaic ) To fold or twist together, intertwine , interlace , entangle , entwine .
